lessons.title: Question: Default
lessons.interactiveContent:
When we use the default flex-basis value of auto, how wide is each of the flex items?

As wide as its content100%50%

As wide as its content.

lessons.title: Question: Flex basis
lessons.interactiveContent:
How can we set the flex item size across the main axis?

Using the flex-basis propertyUsing the flex-direction propertyUsing the row value

Using the flex-basis property.

lessons.title: Example: Percentages
lessons.interactiveContent:
Set flex-basis to 25% for both flex items.

Make sure to pick 25%, followed by 25%.

lessons.title: Example: Y basis
lessons.interactiveContent:
Make the code work by matching the right values with the correct properties.

Make sure to pick 50%, followed by 50%, and finally flex.

lessons.title: Example: Ideal value
lessons.interactiveContent:
Make the flex item's flex-basis value wider than its flex container to show that the flex item will shrink to the ideal value.

Make sure to pick 200px, followed by 150px.

lessons.title: Question: Normal
lessons.interactiveContent:
How do we control the growing of a flex item across the main axis?

With the flex-grow propertyWith the flex-shrink propertyWith the flex-basis property

With the flex-grow property.

lessons.title: Question: Default value
lessons.interactiveContent:
Code the flex-grow property with a value that will make it only as wide as its content.

0auto100

Make sure to pick 0.

lessons.title: Question: Different ratios
lessons.interactiveContent:
Which flex items have the same flex-grow value?

Items 2 and 3Items 1, 2, and 3They are all equal

Items 2 and 3.

lessons.title: Example: More space
lessons.interactiveContent:
Make the first flex item take up the most space in the flex container.

Make sure to pick 3, followed by 1, and finally 1.

lessons.title: Example: Default
lessons.interactiveContent:
Code the default flex-grow value.

Make sure to type 0.

lessons.title: Question: Flex basis
lessons.interactiveContent:
What happens when a flex item cannot reach its initial flex-basis size?

It shrinksIt growsIt stops being a flex item

It shrinks.

lessons.title: Question: Flex shrink default
lessons.interactiveContent:
Pick the default flex-shrink value.

flex-shrink: 1flex-shrink: 0flex-shrink: 500cm

flex-shrink: 1.

lessons.title: Example: Overflow
lessons.interactiveContent:
Make both flex items overflow the flex container and not shrink.

Make sure to pick 0, followed by 0.

lessons.title: Example: Bigger
lessons.interactiveContent:
Make the first flex item shrink more than the second.

Make sure to pick 3, followed by 1.

lessons.title: Example: Different numbers
lessons.interactiveContent:
Make the first and the second flex items shrink less than the third.

Make sure to pick 1, followed by 1.

lessons.title: Question: Default
lessons.interactiveContent:
What are the default size values for each flex item?

flex-grow: 0;, flex-shrink: 1;, flex-basis: auto;flex-grow: 1;, flex-shrink: 1;, flex-basis: 1;flex-grow: 0;, flex-shrink: 1;, flex-basis: 100%;

flex-grow: 0;, flex-shrink: 1;, flex-basis: auto;.

lessons.title: Question: Shorthand
lessons.interactiveContent:
What is the order of properties in the flex shorthand?

flex-grow, flex-shrink, flex-basisflex-shrink, flex-grow, flex-basisflex-grow, flex-shrink

flex-grow, flex-shrink, flex-basis.

lessons.title: Example: Values
lessons.interactiveContent:
Make the first item grow three times as much as the second item.

Make sure to pick 3, followed by 1.

lessons.title: Example: Different Values
lessons.interactiveContent:
Make the second flex item grow 2 times as much as the first item.

Make sure to pick 2, followed by 4.

lessons.title: Example: Different Values 2
lessons.interactiveContent:
Make the first and second flex item both grow and shrink.

Make sure to pick 1 followed by 1 and then 1, 1.
